content: leah michelle designs leahmdesigns@gmail com copycat dishclo th this cotton dishcloth is a quick and easy knit it is simple symmetrical and the two stockinette bands at each end mimic a traditional dishcloth hence the name copycat dishcloth by slipping the first stitch of every row and purling the last stitch the 2 side edges maintain an attractive appearance and the dishcloth lays flat and square without the need for a border yarn bernat handicrafter cotton 100% cotton 80 yd 73 m /50 grams 1 skein shown in #026 notes meadow slip the first st of every row knitwise needles purl the last st of every row one pair size 8 5 0 mm needles or size needed to obtain gauge gauge knitting instructions 8 sts and 16 row = 2 inches in garter st cast on 40 sts work 8 row in garter st knit every row measurements remembering to slip the first st kwise and purl the last approximately 10 inches wide and 11 inches long before washing the dishcloth will shrink 1st stockinette band in the wash especially in the length work 6 row in st st knit one row purl one row washing instructions ending with a ws purl row machine wash and dry main body work in garter st until piece measures 8 5 inches from co ending with a ws row 2nd stockinette band work 6 row in st st ending with a ws purl row work 9 row in garter st bind off all sts weave in ends copyright 2012 2008 by leah michelle designs this pattern photos and products made from this pattern are intended for private use only and may not be distributed for commercial purposes without the written consent of the designer
